adverb.description: Not in or to any place; not anywhere.
examples: plants and animals found nowhere else in the world
Andrea is nowhere to be found
there was nowhere for her to sit
there's nowhere better to experience the wonders of the Rockies

pronoun.description: A place that is remote, uninteresting, or nondescript.
examples: a stretch of road between nowhere and nowhere
the town is a particularly American nowhere

adjective.description: Having no prospect of progress or success.
examples: she's involved in a nowhere affair with a married executive

phrases: he materialized a taxi out of nowhere
One day the lad was walking through the forest when a strange man appeared out of nowhere.
Such plant life seems to appear out of nowhere when the snow and ice recede.
Every town has a few black spots where rubbish seems to appear from nowhere.
Some photographers appeared from nowhere and fired off a load of shots.
